Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos; interior glazed black; exterior: from left, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (only bent arm and trace of chiton remaining); ivy leaf branches in background; on right, part of handle palmette.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Venit identifies the sherd as being in the manner of the Haimon Painter. For parallels regarding the iconography, see Moore and Pease Philippides in 'The Athenian Agora, xxiii. Attic Black-Figured Pottery', 1986, no. 1513.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 87 no. 293 pl. 65)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 366, no. B489, pl. XXVI, pl. CLXXXV)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1268) (phase 3)
